required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Afamelanotide in Patients Suffering With Acne Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomised, Open Label Pilot Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Two Dosage Regimens of Subcutaneous Bioresorbable Afamelanotide Implants in Patients With Mild to Moderate Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effect of afamelanotide on the facial inflammatory acne-related lesions in patients with mild to moderate acne vulgaris, including tolerability of afamelanotide by patients with moderate acne vulgaris and effects of the treatment on quality of life in eligible patients.

primary_outcome.measure: The Change in Number of Facial Inflammatory Acne-related Lesions.

intervention.description: Group A is administered afamelanotide implant on Days 0, 21 and 42; Group B is administered afamelanotide implant on Days 0 and 28.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A pooled analysis of all the patients treated by afamelanotide (group A and group B) was conducted as only 3 patients were recruited in the study (2 in group A and one in group B) due to difficulties in recruitment.

group.title: Afamelanotide (Pooled Analysis)
group.description: Group A are administered afamelanotide implant on Days 0, 21 and 42; Group B are administered afamelanotide implant on Days 0 and 28.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
